dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: If You Invested $10,000 In Apple Stock 10 Years Ago, How Much Would You Have Now?
News Content: If You Invested $10,000 In Apple Stock 10 Years Ago, How Much Would You Have Now?

Benzinga and Yahoo Finance LLC may earn commission or revenue on some items through the links below.

Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL), the largest company in the world with a $3.52 trillion market capitalization, designs, manufactures and markets smartphones, personal computers, tablets, wearables and accessories worldwide.

It is set to report its Q1 2025 earnings on January 30. Wall Street analysts expect the tech giant to post an EPS of $2.35, up from $2.18 in the year-ago period. According to Benzinga Pro, quarterly revenue is expected to reach $124.40 billion, up from $119.58 billion in the previous year.

Don't Miss:

Unlock the hidden potential of commercial real estate — This platform allows individuals to invest in commercial real estate offering a 12% target yield with a bonus 1% return boost today! Maker of the $60,000 foldable home has 3 factory buildings, 600+ houses built, and big plans to solve housing — you can become an investor for $0.80 per share today.

If You Bought Apple Stock 10 Years Ago

The company's stock traded at approximately $27.45 per share 10 years ago. If you had invested $10,000, you could have bought roughly 364 shares. Currently, shares trade at $234.40, meaning your investment's value could have grown to $85,392 from stock price appreciation alone. However, Apple also paid dividends during these 10 years.

Apple's dividend yield is currently 0.43%. Over the last 10 years, it has paid about $18.91 in dividends per share, which means you could have made $6,889 from dividends alone.

Summing up $85,392 and $6,889, we end up with the final value of your investment, which is $92,281. This is how much you could have made if you had invested $10,000 in Apple stock 10 years ago. This means a total return of 822.81%. In comparison, S&P 500 total return for the same period is 228.10%.

See Also: If there was a new fund backed by Jeff Bezos offering a 7-9% target yield with monthly dividends would you invest in it?

What Could The Next 10 Years Bring?

Apple has a consensus rating of "Buy" and a price target of $245.17 based on the ratings of 30 analysts. The price target implies more than a 4% upside from the current stock price.

On Oct. 31, 2024, the company announced its Q4 2024 earnings, posting revenues of $94.9 billion, beating analyst estimates of $94.56 billion, as reported by Benzinga.

The iPhone maker reported fourth-quarter adjusted earnings of $1.64 per share, beating analyst estimates of $1.60 per share. Total revenue was up 6% year over year. Products revenue came in at $69.96 billion, up from $67.18 billion year over year. Services revenue totaled $24.97 billion, up from $22.31 billion year over year.

Story Continues

Trending: Commercial real estate has historically outperformed the stock market, and this platform allows individuals to invest in commercial real estate with as little as $5,000 offering a 12% target yield with a bonus 1% return boost today!

Check out this article by Benzinga, which delves into an extensive industry comparison, evaluating Apple compared to its major competitors within the Technology Hardware, Storage and peripherals industry.

Given just 4% expected upside potential, growth-focused investors may not find Apple stock attractive. Furthermore, the stock won't likely appeal to income-focused investors as it offers a modest dividend yield of 0.43%.

Wondering if your investments can get you to a $5,000,000 nest egg? Speak to a financial advisor today. SmartAsset’s free tool matches you up with up to three vetted financial advisors who serve your area, and you can interview your advisor matches at no cost to decide which one is right for you.

A 9% Return In Just 3 Months

EquityMultiple's ‘Alpine Note — Basecamp Series' is turning heads and opening wallets. This short-term note investment offers investors a 9% rate of return (APY) with just a 3 month term and $5K minimum. The Basecamp rate is at a significant spread to t-bills. This healthy rate of return won't last long. With the Fed poised to cut interest rates in the near future, now could be the time to lock in a favorable rate of return with a flexible, relatively liquid investment option.

What's more, Alpine Note — Basecamp can be rolled into another Alpine Note for compounding returns, or into another of EquityMultiple's rigorously vetted real estate investments, which also carry a minimum investment of just $5K. Basecamp is exclusively open to new investors on the EquityMultiple platform.

Looking for fractional real estate investment opportunities? The Benzinga Real Estate Screener features the latest offerings.

This article If You Invested $10,000 In Apple Stock 10 Years Ago, How Much Would You Have Now? originally appeared on Benzinga.com

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news primarily highlights the struggles of TSMC in expanding its operations in Arizona due to U.S. regulations, which could delay the supply of advanced chips crucial for Apple. As TSMC is a significant supplier for Apple, any delays in chip production may negatively impact Apple's product development and availability, potentially resulting in a decline in investor confidence. While TSMC reassures that the quality matches Taiwan's standards, the challenges in the U.S. raise concerns about supply chain stability. Consequently, there's likely a higher probability of Apple's stock facing downward pressure due to these supply chain concerns, leading to the estimation of a higher probability of stock price fall than rise.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The provided news focuses primarily on IMAX (IMAX) and Netflix (NFLX). While Apple (AAPL) is mentioned as a company that, like Amazon, releases movies theatrically prior to streaming, it is not directly impacted by the specific news of the Narnia deal between IMAX and Netflix. Therefore, the direct impact on Apple's stock price is expected to be minimal. Any movement up or down will mostly depend on overall market sentiment and other Apple-specific news, independent of the IMAX/Netflix deal. So based on this news alone the changes of stock price moving down or up are both 50%.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news article focuses on IMAX and Netflix's deal for the theatrical release of 'Narnia'.  While the news is positive for IMAX, and mentions Apple as a rival streamer that has released movies theatrically, there's no direct impact on Apple's stock price mentioned or implied in the article. The article highlights Netflix's strategic moves and its success, but these are not directly linked to Apple's performance or prospects.  Therefore, the probability of Apple's stock price movement due to this news is expected to be negligible.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news highlights delays in TSMC's Arizona plant due to U.S. regulatory hurdles and labor shortages, which could impact the supply chain for Apple's chips. While TSMC reassures quality matches Taiwan's, the delays might cause concerns about potential disruptions or slower production for Apple's components. However, Apple's diversified supply chain and strong market position may mitigate some negative impacts. The news is more directly negative for TSMC, but Apple could face indirect pressure if chip supply constraints emerge.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article discusses the historical performance of Apple Inc. (AAPL) stock, highlighting that an investment of $10,000 ten years ago would now be worth $92,281, representing an 822.81% return. The article also mentions that Apple has a consensus rating of 'Buy' with a price target of $245.17, implying a 4% upside. However, it notes that the expected upside potential may not be attractive to growth-focused investors, and the modest dividend yield of 0.43% may not appeal to income-focused investors. Given the neutral to slightly positive outlook, I estimate the probability of the stock price rising as 55% and falling as 45%.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news headline provided does not directly relate to Apple Inc. (AAPL) but rather discusses Microsoft's investments and challenges in artificial intelligence. However, Apple Inc. is mentioned in the context of experiencing a significant one-day percentage drop and facing concerns over iPhone sales and weakness in the Chinese market. The overall tone of the news suggests that tech giants, including Apple, are under scrutiny for their performance and growth prospects. Given this context, the Article's indirect relation to Apple and the mixed outlook on tech stocks, I estimate the probability of Apple's stock price rising or falling based on the general sentiment towards tech stocks and the specific challenges mentioned for Apple.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The pause of the AI-generated news alerts by Apple might cause short-term negative sentiment among users and stakeholders, given these features represent the company's entry into innovative technologies. However, Apple often makes iterative updates based on user feedback, so this issue is likely to be resolved, potentially mitigating long-term negative impacts. Moreover, as Apple's core business consists of hardware and high-margin services, which do not seem directly impacted by this situation, the overall effect on the stock could be minimal. Investors' focus on the long-term growth potential of Apple's product ecosystem might overshadow this temporary setback.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news primarily highlights the struggles of TSMC in expanding its U.S. operations due to regulatory and labor challenges, which may lead to delays in the supply of advanced chips necessary for Apple's products. Given that TSMC is a critical supplier for Apple, these setbacks could create uncertainty regarding Apple’s supply chain stability and product availability, potentially leading to a decrease in investor confidence. Consequently, I estimate a higher probability of AAPL's stock price falling rather than rising in light of these challenges.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news focuses on a deal between IMAX and Netflix for exclusive theatrical release of a 'Narnia' film. Apple is mentioned only as a competitor that also releases movies theatrically before putting them on streaming services. The news is positive for IMAX and Netflix but doesn't directly impact Apple's operations or financial outlook. The previous models also generally agree that there will be minimal impact to Apple because it's unrelated to the underlying business of Apple. Taking all of that into consideration, there is no immediate reason to belief whether it would rise or fall beyond overall market sentiment.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.48, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.48, Reasoning: The news focuses on a deal between IMAX and Netflix for the theatrical release of 'Narnia.'  Apple is mentioned only in passing as a competitor that also releases movies theatrically before streaming. There is no direct impact on Apple's business or financial prospects from this news.  The news is largely irrelevant to Apple's stock valuation. Therefore, any movement in Apple's stock price will be driven by other factors, and this news is unlikely to significantly influence it.  Previous predictions show a range of opinions. Given the lack of direct relevance, I'm assigning near-equal probabilities to price increase and decrease, slightly favoring no change based on the minimal impact of this unrelated event.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news highlights TSMC's struggles with U.S. regulations and labor shortages in Arizona, which could delay the supply of advanced chips to Apple. Given TSMC's role as a key supplier for Apple, these delays might negatively impact Apple's supply chain and product timelines, potentially leading to investor concerns. While TSMC reassures quality standards, the operational challenges could create short-term uncertainty. Considering the previous predictions, which lean towards a higher probability of the stock price falling due to supply chain concerns, and the direct relevance of TSMC's issues to Apple's operations, the probability of a stock price fall is slightly higher than a rise.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The provided news article discusses the historical performance of Apple Inc. (AAPL) stock, highlighting that an investment of $10,000 ten years ago would now be worth $92,281, representing an 822.81% return. The article also mentions that Apple has a consensus rating of 'Buy' with a price target of $245.17, implying a 4% upside. However, it notes that the expected upside potential may not be attractive to growth-focused investors, and the modest dividend yield of 0.43% may not appeal to income-focused investors. Given the neutral to slightly positive outlook, I estimate the probability of the stock price rising as 55% and falling as 45%.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: -1, Prediction of stock price falling: -1, Reasoning: Fail to give a prediction. Error Reason: Invalid JSON
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The financial news highlights Apple pausing its AI-generated news alerts due to inaccuracies. This news has a minor direct impact on Apple's operations but could affect the market perception of the company's AI initiatives. While some stakeholders may view this as a setback in innovation, it is important to consider Apple's strong market position, diversified revenue streams, and past iterations and improvements based on feedback. Additionally, the majority of Apple's business comprises hardware and other services, which are not significantly affected by this issue. Previous predictions show a range of sentiments from cautious to optimistic, suggesting a mixed market reaction. Overall, the long-term impact is expected to be limited.
Round: 2
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news highlights significant challenges faced by TSMC in expanding its Arizona operations due to U.S. regulations and labor shortages. As TSMC is a key supplier for Apple, these delays could lead to uncertainties regarding Apple's supply chain for advanced chips, which may negatively impact Apple's product development and investor confidence. Multiple analyses suggested a higher probability of AAPL's stock price falling based on these supply chain concerns, which are directly relevant to Apple's operations. My estimation reflects a cautious stance due to these potential impacts.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news focuses on a deal between IMAX and Netflix for the exclusive theatrical release of 'Narnia.' Apple is only mentioned as a company that also releases movies theatrically before streaming. There is no direct impact on Apple's business or financial prospects from this news. Most previous models also indicate minimal to no impact on Apple's stock due to this news, with probabilities hovering around 0.5 for both rise and fall. Given this lack of direct relevance and the consensus from previous predictions, I'm assigning probabilities reflecting a neutral outlook.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news focuses on a deal between IMAX and Netflix, mentioning Apple only in passing as a competitor with a similar theatrical release strategy.  There is no direct impact on Apple's business or financial prospects from this news. The news is largely irrelevant to Apple's stock valuation. Therefore, any movement in Apple's stock price will primarily be driven by other factors, and this news is unlikely to significantly influence it.  Previous predictions reflect this irrelevance, with most models assigning near-equal probabilities to price increase and decrease, primarily due to other factors at play.  Considering the lack of direct relevance, I'm assigning a slightly higher probability to no change in Apple's stock price than to either a rise or fall.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news highlights TSMC's struggles with U.S. regulations and labor shortages in Arizona, which could delay the supply of advanced chips to Apple. Given TSMC's role as a key supplier for Apple, these delays might negatively impact Apple's supply chain and product timelines, potentially leading to investor concerns. While TSMC reassures quality standards, the operational challenges could create short-term uncertainty. Considering the previous predictions, which lean towards a higher probability of the stock price falling due to supply chain concerns, and the direct relevance of TSMC's issues to Apple's operations, the probability of a stock price fall is slightly higher than a rise.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.52, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.48, Reasoning: The provided news article discusses the historical performance of Apple Inc. (AAPL) stock, highlighting that an investment of $10,000 ten years ago would now be worth $92,281, representing an 822.81% return. The article also mentions that Apple has a consensus rating of 'Buy' with a price target of $245.17, implying a 4% upside. However, it notes that the expected upside potential may not be attractive to growth-focused investors, and the modest dividend yield of 0.43% may not appeal to income-focused investors. Additionally, the article mentions Apple's upcoming Q1 2025 earnings report and its recent Q4 2024 earnings, which beat analyst estimates. Considering the neutral to slightly positive outlook and the mixed predictions from previous models, I estimate the probability of the stock price rising as 52% and falling as 48%.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.42, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.58, Reasoning: The provided news focuses on Microsoft's investments in artificial intelligence and its potential impact on the company's stock price. However, Apple Inc. is mentioned as experiencing a significant one-day percentage drop and facing concerns over iPhone sales and weakness in the Chinese market. Given the indirect relation to Apple and the mixed outlook on tech stocks, I estimate the probability of Apple's stock price movement based on the general sentiment towards tech stocks and the specific challenges mentioned for Apple. Considering the previous predictions, which show a range of opinions, and the fact that the news is not directly related to Apple's operations, I assign a slightly higher probability to the stock price falling due to the overall negative sentiment in the tech industry.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The financial news highlights Apple pausing its AI-generated news alerts due to inaccuracies. This news has a minor direct impact on Apple's operations but could affect the market perception of the company's AI initiatives. While some stakeholders may view this as a setback in innovation, it is important to consider Apple's strong market position, diversified revenue streams, and past iterations and improvements based on feedback. Additionally, the majority of Apple's business comprises hardware and other services, which are not significantly affected by this issue. Previous predictions show a range of sentiments from cautious to optimistic, suggesting a mixed market reaction. Overall, the long-term impact is expected to be limited.
Round: 3
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news regarding TSMC's struggles with U.S. regulations and labor shortages suggests potential delays in the supply of advanced chips essential for Apple. As TSMC is a critical supplier for Apple, these challenges could lead to concerns about Apple's product availability and overall supply chain stability. Previous predictions indicate a trend toward sentiment focused on the negative implications of these supply chain issues for Apple, resulting in a higher probability of stock price decline rather than an increase. Consequently, I estimate a greater likelihood of Apple's stock price falling due to these supply chain disruptions, while a smaller probability reflects possible market resilience and long-term growth.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news focuses on a deal between IMAX and Netflix for exclusive theatrical release of 'Narnia.' Apple is mentioned as a competitor releasing movies theatrically before streaming. This deal has little or no direct impact on Apple's core business or financial outlook. While Apple is in the streaming space as well as involved in theatrical releases, the IMAX/Netflix news doesn't substantially affect Apple's potential. The previous round models mostly converged to indicate minimal impact of this news to Apple. Therefore, any movement of AAPL stock prices rely more on market sentiments and unrelated news. So in this case, I assigned probabilities reflecting a neutral outlook.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.48, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.48, Reasoning: The news article focuses on a deal between IMAX and Netflix for the theatrical release of the movie "Narnia."  Apple is mentioned only in passing as a competitor that also utilizes a theatrical release strategy before streaming. There is no direct impact on Apple's business or financial prospects from this news.  The news is largely irrelevant to Apple's stock valuation. Therefore, any movement in Apple's stock price will be driven by other factors, and this news is unlikely to significantly influence it.  Previous predictions show a wide range of probabilities, reflecting the lack of direct relevance of the news to Apple. Considering this irrelevance, I am assigning near-equal probabilities to a price increase and a decrease, with a slight lean towards no change, given the minimal impact of the unrelated event.  The consistent near-equal probabilities across multiple prediction rounds further supports this assessment.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news highlights TSMC's struggles with U.S. regulations and labor shortages in Arizona, which could delay the supply of advanced chips to Apple. Given TSMC's role as a key supplier for Apple, these delays might negatively impact Apple's supply chain and product timelines, potentially leading to investor concerns. While TSMC reassures quality standards, the operational challenges could create short-term uncertainty. Considering the previous predictions, which lean towards a higher probability of the stock price falling due to supply chain concerns, and the direct relevance of TSMC's issues to Apple's operations, the probability of a stock price fall is slightly higher than a rise.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: -1, Prediction of stock price falling: -1, Reasoning: Fail to give a prediction. Error Reason: Parse error
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.42, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.58, Reasoning: The provided news primarily focuses on Microsoft's investments in artificial intelligence and its potential impact on Microsoft's stock price. However, Apple Inc. is mentioned as experiencing a significant one-day percentage drop and facing concerns over iPhone sales and weakness in the Chinese market. Given the indirect relation to Apple and the mixed outlook on tech stocks, I estimate the probability of Apple's stock price movement based on the general sentiment towards tech stocks and the specific challenges mentioned for Apple. Considering the previous predictions, which show a range of opinions, and the fact that the news is not directly related to Apple's operations, I assign a slightly higher probability to the stock price falling due to the overall negative sentiment in the tech industry.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The financial news highlights Apple pausing its AI-generated news alerts due to inaccuracies. Although this has a minor direct impact on Apple's operations, it affects the market perception of the company's AI initiatives. Apple maintains a strong market position and diversified revenue streams, potentially mitigating the long-term implications of this issue. Previous predictions show mixed reactions but lean more towards a cautious outlook, considering various challenges including supply chain issues and concerns over tech sector performance.


Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
    "reasoning": "The provided news article discusses the historical performance of Apple Inc. (AAPL) stock, highlighting an investment of $10,000 ten years ago would now be worth $92,281, representing an 822.81% return. The article also mentions a consensus rating of 'Buy' with a price target of $245.17, implying a 4% upside. However, it notes that the expected upside potential may not be attractive to growth-focused investors, and the modest dividend yield of 0.43% may not appeal to income-focused investors. Additionally, the article mentions Apple's upcoming Q1 2025 earnings report and its recent Q4 2024 earnings, which beat analyst estimates. Considering the neutral to slightly positive outlook and the mixed predictions from previous models, I estimate the probability of the stock price rising as 45% and falling as 55%.",
    "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
    "company_symbol": "AAPL",
    "news_headline": "If You Invested $10,000 In Apple Stock 10 Years Ago, How Much Would You Have Now?",
    "probability_of_stock_price_rise": 0.45,
    "probability_of_stock_price_fall": 0.55
}
```
